# Pericardial Effusion

Related: Cardiac Tamponade (@sec-tamponade)

- Amount of fluid (in mL) that is *normally* within the pericardial space: 15 to 50 mL
- EKG: Electrical alternans
    - the amplitudes of the QRS complexes vary from beat to beat
- CXR: enlarged 'water-bottle' heart

## Electrical alternans

- the amplitudes of the QRS complexes vary from beat to beat
- seen if large pericardial effusion
